segment.source: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Reports
segment.target: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Reports

segment.source: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Reports
segment.target: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Reports

segment.source: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Reports
segment.target: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Reports

segment.source: Use these procedures to move the Reports feature from one computer to another, that is, to move the Reports feature from Server A to Server B.
segment.target: Use these procedures to move the Reports feature from one computer to another, that is, to move the Reports feature from Server A to Server B.

segment.source: The high-level steps for moving the Reports feature are:
segment.target: The high-level steps for moving the Reports feature are:

segment.source: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Install the MBAM 2.5 Server software on Server B and configure the Reports feature on Server B.
segment.target: Install the MBAM 2.5 Server software on Server B and configure the Reports feature on Server B.

segment.source: Update the reports connection data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: Update the reports connection data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: Resume the instance of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Resume the instance of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run the example Windows PowerShell scripts in this topic, you must update the Windows PowerShell execution policy to enable scripts to be run.
segment.target: To run the example Windows PowerShell scripts in this topic, you must update the Windows PowerShell execution policy to enable scripts to be run.

segment.source: See Running Windows PowerShell Scripts for instructions.
segment.target: See Running Windows PowerShell Scripts for instructions.

segment.source: Stop the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Stop the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On the server that is running the Administration and Monitoring Website, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: On the server that is running the Administration and Monitoring Website, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Install MBAM Server software and run the MBAM Server Configuration wizard on Server B
segment.target: Install MBAM Server software and run the MBAM Server Configuration wizard on Server B

segment.source: Install the MBAM Server software on Server B. For instructions, see Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Server software on Server B. For instructions, see Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software.

segment.source: On Server B, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard, click Add New Features, and then select only the Reports feature.
segment.target: On Server B, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard, click Add New Features, and then select only the Reports feature.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can use the Enable-MbamReport Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Reports.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can use the Enable-MbamReport Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Reports.

segment.source: For instructions on how to configure the Reports, see How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports.
segment.target: For instructions on how to configure the Reports, see How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports.

segment.source: Update the reports connection data on the Administration and Monitoring Server
segment.target: Update the reports connection data on the Administration and Monitoring Server

segment.source: On the server that is running the Reports feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Reports URL.
segment.target: On the server that is running the Reports feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Reports URL.

segment.source: Expand Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring, and then select the HelpDesk node.
segment.target: Expand Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring, and then select the HelpDesk node.

segment.source: In the Management section of the Features View, select Configuration Editor.
segment.target: In the Management section of the Features View, select Configuration Editor.

segment.source: In the Section field, select appSettings.
segment.target: In the Section field, select appSettings.

segment.source: Select the Collection row, and then click the "ellipses" button (…) at the far right of the pane to open the Collection Editor.
segment.target: Select the Collection row, and then click the "ellipses" button (…) at the far right of the pane to open the Collection Editor.

segment.source: In the Collection Editor, select the row that contains Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url, and update the value for Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url to reflect the server name for Server B.
segment.target: In the Collection Editor, select the row that contains Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url, and update the value for Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url to reflect the server name for Server B.

segment.source: If you previously configured the Reports feature on a named instance of SQL Server Reporting Services, add or update the name of the instance to the URL, for example:
segment.target: If you previously configured the Reports feature on a named instance of SQL Server Reporting Services, add or update the name of the instance to the URL, for example:

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to run a command on the Administration and Monitoring Server that is similar to the following code example.
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to run a command on the Administration and Monitoring Server that is similar to the following code example.

segment.source: Using the descriptions in the following table, replace the values in the code example with values that match your environment.
segment.target: Using the descriptions in the following table, replace the values in the code example with values that match your environment.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$

segment.source: Name of the server to which the Reports were moved.
segment.target: Name of the server to which the Reports were moved.

segment.source: $SRSINSTANCENAME$
segment.target: $SRSINSTANCENAME$

segment.source: Name of the instance of SQL Server Reporting Services to which the Reports were moved.
segment.target: Name of the instance of SQL Server Reporting Services to which the Reports were moved.

segment.source: Resume the instance of the Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Resume the instance of the Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On the server that is running the Administration and Monitoring Website, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: On the server that is running the Administration and Monitoring Website, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to run a command that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to run a command that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run this command, you must add the IIS module for Windows PowerShell to the current instance of Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: To run this command, you must add the IIS module for Windows PowerShell to the current instance of Windows PowerShell.
